answer.body:
Yes, pregnant women can attend the National Day Parade (NDP) in Singapore. There are generally no specific restrictions that prevent pregnant women from attending the event.

However, it's important for pregnant women to consider their own comfort, health, and safety when deciding to attend crowded events like the NDP. Given the large crowds, long hours, and potential standing or walking for extended periods, pregnant women may want to take certain precautions.

It's advisable to wear comfortable clothing and shoes, stay hydrated, and take breaks as needed. Additionally, it's recommended to consult with a healthcare professional for personalized advice based on the individual's pregnancy stage and any specific medical considerations

questionListItems.title: Where can I access the NDP2023 Brand Guidelines?

answer.body: Please reach us at ndp2023@defence.gov.sg for the NDP 2023 Brand Guidelines.

questionListItems.title: I can’t find what I need here, are there other forms of feedback/contact?

answer.body:
You may contact us via our NDP email address at ndp2023@defence.gov.sg. Alternatively, you can call our NDP Hotline at 1800-NDP-2023 (1800-637-2023).

Please note that the operating hours of the NDP Hotline will be as such:

(1) Weekdays: 9am to 6pm

(2) Saturdays: 9am to 9pm from 10 Jun 23 onwards (Closed on 1 Jul 23)

(3) We are closed on all Sundays and Public Holidays (Except for 2 Jul 23 and 6 Aug 23, from 9am to 9pm)

questionListItems.title: Is the ticketing for Heartland Festivals on a first-come-first-served basis?

answer.body: Yes. tickets for the Heartland Festivals sites will be released from 15 July on a first come-first-served basis. Each Singaporean/ Permanent Resident will be able to apply for either 2 or 4 tickets.

questionListItems.title: How many tickets can I register for?

answer.body: Each person can apply for either 2 or 4 tickets.

questionListItems.title: Can I pass my tickets to others if I cannot attend the shows?

answer.body: Yes, you can pass your tickets to others if you are unable to attend the show. However, please exercise caution to ensure that the tickets are not misused.

questionListItems.title: I’m a Non-Citizen/LTVP/WorkPass/StudentPass, can I ballot for NDP Tickets?

answer.body: Only Singapore Citizens and Permanent Residents are allowed to ballot for NDP Tickets.

questionListItems.title: May I know which roads will be closed from July onwards?

answer.body: We will share the information in due time, please visit www.ndp.gov.sg for the latest updates.

questionListItems.title: I saw tickets to NDP 2023 – GetActive! Singapore Heartland Festivals sold online. Is it safe to purchase them?

answer.body: GetActive! SG Heartland Festivals tickets are strictly NOT FOR SALE and should not be purchased through unauthorised channels, as this poses a high risk of fraud or scams. Tickets obtained from such sources may be rendered void, and individuals holding such tickets may be denied entry to the venue. If you come across any unauthorised sale of tickets, please report it to the NDP 2023 committee or the relevant authorities.

questionListItems.title: I may have accidentally deleted my email containing the e-tickets. Can I request for the email again?

answer.body: Please attempt to retrieve the email by checking your deleted email folder. If you have indeed deleted the email and it is unrecoverable, kindly email us at ndpeeps@defence.gov.sg and we will be happy to assist you.

questionListItems.title: How can I apply for e-tickets?

answer.body: To apply for tickets, you can access and submit the application form starting from 12:00pm (GMT+8) on 15 Jul 2023. Click here to apply. Please note that the tickets are allocated on a first-come-first-served basis.

questionListItems.title: What can I look forward to during the NDP weekend?

answer.body:
Over the weekend of 5 and 6 August, celebratory activities will be organised at 5 heartland locations. Singaporeans can look forward to exciting performances, activities and sports try-out for heartlanders of all ages, and many more! 

On 9 August, aerial elements will also make their way into the heartlands. The state flag carried by the Chinook will soar around the island, while our F-16 fighter jets will fly past homes across the nation. Fireworks will be set off in the heartlands, concurrent with that at the Padang.

questionListItems.title: Where and when will the F-16 fighter jets fly-past?

answer.body: On 9 August, from 5.45pm to 6.05pm, six F-16D and two F-15SG fighter jets accompanied by one A330 MRTT will execute the Fighter Island Flypast, in a delta formation, across the nation.

questionListItems.title: What do I have to bring for the personnel checks before entry into the Padang during the actual show day?

answer.body: Do bring your physical tickets for entry and avoid carrying bulky items such as large bags and large umbrellas. This will help expedite security checks and ensure a smooth entry for all attendees. Please refer to the Admission Advisory provided here for further guidance.

questionListItems.title: What should I look out for in the email when I receive the e-tickets?

answer.body: The e-tickets email will be sent from the address ndp2023@klook.com and will inform you of the number of tickets and the day of Heartland Festival that you have successfully applied for. Additionally, the email will include PDF copies of the e-tickets.
